DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine the difference in pain scales between absorbable suture types for second-degree perineal laceration repair.
DOC.brief_title: Comparison of Absorbable Sutures in Perineal Laceration Repair
DOC.criteria: At least 18 years of age Able to sign informed consent Vaginal laceration that requires sutures but does not involve the anal sphincter (thirddegree tear) or rectal mucosa (fourthdegree tear) Inability to speak and understand English or Spanish Previous diagnosis of vulvodynia, dyspareunia, or other chronic vulvar pain syndrome Extensive perineal warts or vulvar varicosities
